Package org.neo4j.kernel.api.index

Class IndexProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.kernel.lifecycle.LifecycleAdapter
      • org.neo4j.kernel.api.index.IndexProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndexConfigCompleter, Lifecycle
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FulltextIndexProvider, FusionIndexProvider, IndexProvider.Adaptor, IndexProvider.Delegating, LuceneIndexProvider, NativeIndexProvider
    public abstract class IndexProvider
extends LifecycleAdapter
implements IndexConfigCompleter
    Contract for implementing an index in Neo4j. This is a sensitive thing to implement, because it manages data that is controlled by Neo4js logical log. As such, the implementation needs to behave under some rather strict rules.

    Populating the index

    When an index rule is added, the IndexingService is notified. It will, in turn, ask your IndexProvider for a getPopulator(IndexDescriptor, IndexSamplingConfig, ByteBufferFactory, MemoryTracker, TokenNameLookup) batch index writer}. A background index job is triggered, and all existing data that applies to the new rule, as well as new data from the "outside", will be inserted using the writer. You are guaranteed that usage of this writer, during population, will be single threaded. These are the rules you must adhere to here:
    • You CANNOT say that the state of the index is InternalIndexState.ONLINE
    • You MUST store all updates given to you
    • You MAY persistently store the updates

    The Flip

    Once population is done, the index needs to be "flipped" to an online mode of operation. The index will be notified, through the IndexPopulator.close(boolean, PageCursorTracer) method, that population is done, and that the index should turn it's state to InternalIndexState.ONLINE or InternalIndexState.FAILED depending on the value given to the IndexPopulator.close(boolean, PageCursorTracer) close method}. If the index is persisted to disk, this is a vital part of the index lifecycle. For a persisted index, the index MUST NOT store the state as online unless it first guarantees that the entire index is flushed to disk. Failure to do so could produce a situation where, after a crash, an index is believed to be online when it in fact was not yet fully populated. This would break the database recovery process. If you are implementing this interface, you can choose to not store index state. In that case, you should report index state as InternalIndexState.POPULATING upon startup. This will cause the database to re-create the index from scratch again. These are the rules you must adhere to here:
    • You MUST have flushed the index to durable storage if you are to persist index state as InternalIndexState.ONLINE
    • You MAY decide not to store index state
    • If you don't store index state, you MUST default to InternalIndexState.POPULATING

    Online operation

    Once the index is online, the database will move to using the online accessor to write to the index.

      • getPopulationFailure

        public abstract String getPopulationFailure​(IndexDescriptor descriptor,
                                            PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Returns a failure previously gotten from IndexPopulator.markAsFailed(String) Implementations are expected to persist this failure
        Parameters:
        descriptor - IndexDescriptor of the index.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer
        Returns:
        failure, in the form of a stack trace, that happened during population or empty string if there is no failure

      • getInitialState

        public abstract InternalIndexState getInitialState​(IndexDescriptor descriptor,
                                                   PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Called during startup to find out which state an index is in. If InternalIndexState.FAILED is returned then a further call to getPopulationFailure(IndexDescriptor, PageCursorTracer) is expected and should return the failure accepted by any call to IndexPopulator.markAsFailed(String) call at the time of failure.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - to get initial state for.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer.
